title: Linux nm Command with Practical Examples
description: Explore the Linux nm command, which displays symbol information for object files. Learn how to use nm to view executable symbols, filter results, and gain practical insights.

meta.title: Linux nm Command with Practical Examples
meta.description: Explore the Linux nm command, which displays symbol information for object files. Learn how to use nm to view executable symbols, filter results, and gain practical insights.
meta.keywords: Linux, nm command, symbol information, executable, object files, filtering, scripting, programming

verify.name: Verify the creation of the hello.c file
verify.hint: Please make sure you have created the hello.c file in the ~/project directory.

steps.title: Displaying Symbol Information of an Executable

verify.name: Verify the output of nm command
verify.hint: Please make sure the output of the nm command includes the "main" and "printf" symbols.

steps.title: Filtering Symbol Information Using nm Options

verify.name: Verify the output of nm command with filtering options
verify.hint: Please make sure the output of the nm -T command includes the "main" symbol.
